fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • In two articles about British Steel, Scunthorpe was referred to as one of the UK’s last two steelworks. That should have said “last two blast furnace steelworks” (British Steel seeking state funds in £75m rescue deal, 15 May, page 2; British Steel rescued from collapse by cash injection, 17 May, page 33). • The 1990s TV drama Band of Gold was set in Bradford, not Leeds as a feature said (Wainwright’s way, 17 May, page 9, Journal). • Other recently corrected articles include: Everyone welcome: inside the schools that haven’t expelled a child since 2013 Bill de Blasio: why won’t people take New York mayor’s 2020 bid seriously? Bistro Lotte, Frome, Somerset: B&B review Bird lovers flock to Berkeley Square as nightingales return Are alternative meats the key to a healthier life and planet? – Science Weekly podcast
